p: Ferula assa-foetida L. ( F. assa-foetida L.) or asafoetida belongs to the Apiaceae family. Its gum resin is obtained from the exudates of the living underground rhizome or taproots of the plant. F. assa-foetida or gum-resin is known as “Anghouzeh,” “Khorakoma,” and “Anguzakoma” in Iran [ 90]. One conducted study revealed that the sesquiterpene coumarins, isolated from CHCl3-soluble extract of F. assa-foetida, showed higher potency against the influenza A virus (H1N1) (IC50 0.26–0.86 μg/mL) than amantadine (IC50 0.92 μg/mL) [ 91].
